Uses of XScale in DataSetTools.dataset
 

Subclasses of XScale in DataSetTools.dataset
 class GeometricProgressionXScale
          The class for "X" scales that consist of points forming a geometric progression, xN = x0 * r^N along a specified interval.
 class UniformXScale
          The class for "X" scales that consist of evenly spaced points along a a specified interval.
 class VariableXScale
          The class for variable "X" scales that consist of a sequence of points in an interval with arbitrary spacing between points.

          Constructs a new VariableXScale that extends over the smallest interval containing both this XScale and the specifed XScale.

          Constructs a new XScale that is the restriction of the current XScale to the intersection of the ClosedInterval and the interval of the current XScale.

static int XScale.Test_GetI_GetI_GLB(XScale scale, int num_points)
          Verify that getI(x) and getI_GLB(x) return correct values for a collection of randomly generated "xs" in the interval [start_x-1, end_x+1].
static int XScale.Test_GetXofGetI(XScale scale)
          Verify that getX(getI(x)) == x for every point "x" in the XScale.
static int XScale.Test_GetXsGetX(XScale scale)
          Verify that the points returned in an array by getXs() are the same as those returned by individual calls to getX().
